pkgmetadata.longdescription: Distributions for Generalized Additive Models for Location Scale and Shape // A set of distributions which can be used for modelling the response variables in Generalized Additive Models for Location Scale and Shape, Rigby and Stasinopoulos (2005), doi:10.1111/j.1467-9876.2005.00510.x. The distributions can be continuous, discrete or mixed distributions. Extra distributions can be created, by transforming, any continuous distribution defined on the real line, to a distribution defined on ranges 0 to infinity or 0 to 1, by using a ''log'' or a ''logit' transformation respectively.
